name: ENERGY STAR Res. ASHP (FS) CC

market_entry_year_source.notes: Standard goes into effect in 2023, but assume equipment is already on the market that meets the spec.

source_data.title: ENERGY STAR Program Requirements Product Specification for Central Air Conditioner and Heat Pump Equipment Version 6.0

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Split system (see table 3); conversion from original standard: COP = SEER / 3.412, COP = HSPF / 3.412 (see EIA source)

source_data.title: ENERGY STAR Program Requirements for Central Air-Conditioners and Heat Pumps, v6
Residential Demand Module of the National Energy Modeling System: Model Documentation 2014

installed_cost_source.notes: Installed costs for best ASHP in 2017, to account for bump to new ESTAR performance spec level; for existing buildings, added service costs of $1K for natural gas and $2K for distillate/other assigned based on EIA report, and added costs of $3K for new circuit breaker panel based on Redwood Energy report.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
Residential End Uses: Area 2: Incremental Installed Costs for Efficiency Upgrades
A Pocket Guide to All-Electric Retrofits of Single-Family Homes
source_data.author: Sean Armstrong, Emily Higbee, Dylan Anderson, Diane Bailey, Tom Kabat

product_lifetime_source.notes: Median of average ENERGY STAR lifetime in 2017

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

market_scaling_fractions_source.heating: Applies to all residential fuel-fired heating; no electric heating is switched by this ECM

cooling.title: RECS 2015 Microdata
cooling.fraction_derivation: Central AC multiple of 59.5% was determined as a proportion of total homes with a ducted cooling system where heating is done using any non-electric heating energy source. Total homes with ducted cooling in the sample is 76,090,522, and then filtered for homes with fuel-fired heating system (45,241,958).

_description: Standard size residential air source heat pump that meets the ENERGY STAR performance standard, cold-climate
